page.title: 17Grouse Shooting
page.content: The{red grouse}is found on the moors around{Glossop.}It lives on the{ {young heather.} Landowners often burn off the old heather in spring to encourage new growth. The grouse shooting season starts on the{12th August,}and lasts until autumn. On the days shooting takes place the moors are closed to walkers. Signs are posted at all access points. The beaters walk towards the shooting butts which hide those shooting. The beaters make a lot of noise so that the grouse fly up into the air and are shot with a double barrelled shotgun. Dogs then bring back the dead grouse. The grouse may be eaten. They are hung up in a cupboard or shed for 8 weeks prior to eating. Some groups oppose this sport and disrupt the shooting.
